Hi ALL Builders! Here I am again. ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif) I don't know if my post is suitable in here. I just hope the Board will okey for this particular post of mine... It is because it has portion of a successfull of building my Multiboot DVD. (Booting to 3 BootSDI.img, AcronisMediaRecovery.iso, and my DOS utilities.) It has a portion of little "How To", and a portion for a help from Jaclaz.. about incorporating a little code of GRUB in my MultiBoot DVD. Before I continue, I just wanna say THANKS to Thuun for his GOOD work in "CreateBcdwPE.Script". Because without this script, my build will not be realized. And also thanks to Jaclaz who help me in my last post. I already using it. It gives me a BIG help in fixing PC's as for my way of living. And now that I successfuly build my MultiBoot DVD, I don't how to express my joy and how to say THANK you Builders.. I already using it for almost a month now. It saves time in repairing computers. And now I would say my joy begins here... After I downloaded "CreateBcdwPE.Script" [http://www.boot-land...mp;showfile=152](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?autocom=Downloads&showfile=152 "External link") by Thuun, I then browse to my archive files of different version of Winbuilders, from my backup Hard Disk. I run the script for the very first time. then I burned the "LiveXP.iso" result, It almost makes my eyes wide open like the "Power puff girls eyes" in excitement saying "got ya.." ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif) Booting to SDI.img in CD/DVD will be possible now... ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif) Beacuse my plan is booting to multi SDI images,by choosing which image I want to boot to. (Depending the size of physiacl memory of the Mother Board itself). I run the script to every version of WB. Then I choosed the "lx101408cxs" which is good for me. And I Keep experimenting with it, customizing to suit my needs. Until it gives me a "Thumbs Up" ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif) (see pic1 \& pic2 from attachment)
And here is a little How TO...(Only to those who didn't know it yet)....(Like ME) He...He.... ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif) BTW, I using the BootSDI.img build from this version "lx101408cxs" (sorry I forgot where \& who's signature it was, maybe from Amalux, or Lancelot. Thanks anyway to both). I provided you my ready-made "Bootable iso" just to give you a ittle time for this. By the way, for those who didn't know it yet, (no offense.. He..he..) I got the BootSDI.img from ISO folder in Ram subfolder then inside I386 subfolder (e.g. C:\\lx101408cxs\\ISO\\Ram\\I386). Of course the path differs from yours. Just rename your images (if you want 3 images) to the names "WinPE.img, WinSD.img \& WnSDI.img. You can use one image if you want. Just read the "Readme.txt" (attachment) for more info of my images. Open "LiveXP.iso" (attachment) in PowerISO. Then "Drag \& Drop" your images.. inside the I386 folder in the opened PowerISO programs. Note... DO NOT EDIT ANYTHING INSIDE THE LiveXP.iso. Just add your images into it.(See Pic3 for reference). Except if you use other name for the DOS.ima image, You must edit the "bcdw.ini" entry. Do not edit the 3 SETUPLDR.BIN (R,S,\& T) if you used the names of 3 images I provided. You can experiment it later on. I already edited it to correspond the name of my 3 images. (WinPE.img, WinSD.img \& WnSDI.img) Also do not edit the 3 SIF files... WINPE.SIF, WINSD.SIF \& WNSDI.SIF. (see pic4) You can open it with the notepad to see it, So simple Duh!. After you finish adding your images, you can save it if you want, then press the burn icon button in PowerISO. Of course, you must see to it that your New LiveXP.iso will fit CDR/W disc. if not used DVDR/W instead. Then you can restart your PC and boot from it. And that is all Guys..I hope somebody find it usefull as I did. And my last portion is this. just simple. I hope Jaclaz will response, because he is ONE of an expert in GRUB.. "How can I incorporate Grub" in bcdw.ini? I want to have the 6th option that when I select it, (see pic1) it gives me another option "Start GRUB4DOS Menu", then it gives another option from the Menu.lst.. "Boot from RAMDISK" for just one SDI.img to boot from. Anyway, I'm contented with my current build, I just want to know which is good in booting SDI.img. (The BCDW or GRUB) I prefer SDI.img only because it boots faster than normal iso.
Thanks in advance Jaclaz. I know its just a "Tip of an Iceberg" for you. And MORE power to you and the rest of the builders...You are ALL a part of my success...(Someday!!! He...he..) ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif) Ariom.. P.S. I hope Jaclaz can make a "script" also like Thuun did in his "CreateBcdwPE.Script". ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif) My attacment ~~is~~ **was** [Here](http://www.nowhere.no "External link")

forumNotes.author: was_jaclaz
forumNotes.content:
Moved to "booting".  

Removed attachment.  

NO sharing of prebuilt ISO, possibly containing Microsoft files.  

Can you post your actual questions without the "fluff"?  

I mean, I am happy you found a suitable way ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif), and that you were kind enough as to report your success, but WHICH are the actual questions? ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)  

![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)  

jaclaz  

P.S.: Half the problems I have seen with .ISO files PE related were caused by using editing tools to modify the .ISO.  
This probably does not affect a .iso containing just .img's ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif), but it's not the suggested way, it takes all of three minutes to rebuild a .iso properly through mkisofs.

map --hook

and this..

map /img/Bios.ima (fd0)

But no success!!! ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)   

Ariom

forumNotes.author: ireneuszp
forumNotes.content: Try this: ``` title Floppy image find --set-root /Bios.ima map /Bios.ima (fd0) map --hook chainloader (fd0)+1 rootnoverify (fd0) map --floppies=1 title Floppy image find --set-root /img/Bios.ima map /img/Bios.ima (fd0) map --hook chainloader (fd0)+1 rootnoverify (fd0) map --floppies=1 ```
